name: Sharneil Shapland
summary: I am an enthusiastic and professional client focused individual. I thrive on achieving positive outcomes both as a team and independently.

education.institution: Gold Coast Institute of TAFE, Coomera
education.field_of_study: Diploma of Building Design & Technology, Certificate 4 in Residential Design

education.institution: Gold Coast Institute of TAFE, Southport
Gold Coast Institute of TAFE, Southport

interests: Outdoor Activities, Fishing, Camping, Baking and Cooking

experience.achievements: Supported the sales team throughout the quotation, contractual and design phases of each new project. Processed all variation and amendment changes to the design while liaising with the client and all relevant parties internally. Completed quality check of the working drawing plans to ensure no errors were present and all contracted items were present and drawn appropriately. Main point of contact for the client, updated them at each stage of construction until handover and organized required inspections with the Site Supervisors. Managed referrer relationships to ensure our arrangement remained productive and to ensure all relevant information was passed onto the client appropriately. Assisted in the restructuring of the colour selection process for the client to ensure this was a streamline experience.

Processed Queensland building claims within the Catastrophe team. Managed the contractual process for residential and commercial property works. Handled customer service phone calls and liaised with Contractors, Supervisors and Estimators on insurance repair works.

Established strong relationships with the Architect and Interior Designer community by providing a technical and consultative approach to the position. Gained specifications on projects within the commercial development industry and managed the project pipeline. Attended network industry events to identify decision makers within the specification process. Prepared and conducted CPD presentations to Architects and Interior Designers. Completed specialist product presentations to new and existing clients. Worked to ensure internal sales and activity targets were met as a team.
experience.organisation: GWA Group - Bathrooms & Kitchens - Caroma, Dorf & Stylus

experience.achievements: Managed a diverse territory across Brisbane, Gold Coast, Northern NSW & Moreton Bay Region. Formed supportive relationships with varying types of veterinary clinics and emergency hospitals to improve their business productivity. Identified sales and service opportunities within clinics to increase purchases. Used reporting tools to identify growth opportunities and deficit areas. Ensured all clients within the allocated territory were kept informed about new product ranges and provided with the relevant supporting material. Planned and booked a rotating roster to ensure all clients were visited on an appropriate cycle to maximize the level of service.

Developed relationships with investment property owners through networking, cold calling and business/client referrals. Trained in negotiation skills, client retention and effective processing of new property managements. Processing referrals from the development team to ensure the final phases of the construction process were handled professionally and to ensure a tenant was secured for the property upon handover. Ensured all new management properties were in an appropriate condition for tenants to be placed, this often involved organizing minor renovations, cleaning and general repairs. Completed the property management agreements prior to handing over to the property management team.

Obtained property listings through growing and servicing a database and targeting listed properties, actively creating opportunities with both existing contacts and external leads. Achieved KPI driven targets and constantly developed skills and knowledge through regular training. Trained in the sales transaction process and the importance of marketing, negotiating throughout the listing process, demonstrating knowledge of market trends and change factors.

key_skills: Client Relationship Builder, Detail Orientated, Organised, Team Builder, Professional, Experienced in CRM Operation & Microsoft Office Operation, Experienced in Construction and Design

name: Anna Merenkova
summary: Highly organized and detail-oriented professional with a strong background in customer service and administrative support. Skilled in managing multiple tasks, coordinating activities, and ensuring efficient office operations. Looking to apply strong communication and organizational skills in an entry-level office role in Brisbane.

experience.achievements: Provide administrative support including scheduling, filing, and maintaining client records. Assist HR with recruitment tasks such as posting job ads, coordinating interviews, and updating employee files. Support basic accounting tasks, including tracking invoices, payroll, and expense reporting. Assist in marketing efforts by managing social media updates and coordinating small promotional activities. Perform general office duties to ensure smooth daily operations in a small business setting.

Delivered high-quality customer service, ensuring passenger satisfaction. Collaborated with team members to resolve operational challenges in a fast-paced environment. Prepared detailed post-flight reports, documenting performance and customer feedback. Developed excellent communication and problem-solving skills.

Processed financial transactions, payroll, and client invoices with attention to accuracy. Assisted in preparing financial reports to aid management decision-making. Enhanced multitasking and organizational skills in a busy office environment.

key_skills: Administrative Support: Capable of handling office tasks, managing schedules, and maintaining records. Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills developed through customer service and administrative roles. Organization: Able to manage multiple tasks effectively, ensuring smooth workflow in busy environments. Technical Proficiency: Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook), with a focus on data entry and reporting. Teamwork: A collaborative team player who supports colleagues and contributes to shared objectives.

name: Hayden Smith
summary: I am reliable hard working Year 11 student seeking casual or part-time customer service work in a sports retail environment. Having played soccer for nine years and a keen all-round sports enthusiast, I am looking to contribute knowledge and proven communications skills.

education.field_of_study: Maths, English, Business Management, VET studies in Sport and Recreation

interests: Played soccer since the age of eight. Keen spectator of soccer, football and cricket.

experience.achievements: Served customers. Handled cash including operating of cash register.

key_skills: Customer service ability demonstrated when working efficiently in soccer club canteen. Numeracy skills for cash handling tasks proven by achieving good results for mathematics subjects. Highly developed communication skills shown by receiving positive feedback from supervisors after completing work experience. Strong ability to work as part of a team developed through participating in soccer since the age of eight. Demonstrated organisation skills as a result handing all assignments in on time. Able to take responsibility and solve problems proven through umpiring and coaching.
